page.title: 09CARNIVAL TIME AT LEIGHTON
page.content: The Leighton Buzzard Carnival was started in 1960 and is organised by a volunteer committee, it is held every year at Parsons Close, and is a day of fun for everyone. Lorries are converted into floats by people from Clubs, Associations and Local Firms. They are very colourful and show different scenes. Children and adults wearing gay costumes go on the floats. In the late afternoon they parade through the town and local areas. In an arena there are displays by dancers, bands, gymnasts or other things people will enjoy watching. Side shows are arranged by local organizations who keep 50% of any profit made. The remainder together with any other profits from the carnival are donated to local charities. There is also a fair in the park with roundabouts and rides.
